bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to Josiah Quincy, July 18, 1893
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: No. 26. Consulate-General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, July 18, 1893.
Mr. Beverly Y. Payne, to the Department of State.

p.add: REPORT FILED IN Bureau of Statistics, FOR PUBLICATION.

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, July 18, 1893.
Honorable Josiah Quincy, Assistant Secretary of State, Washington, D. C.

Sir: I have the honor to acknowledge receipt of your Circular of May 30, last, requesting a report concerning poultry industry, which has my attention, and will be reported to the Department at the earliest practicable date.
I have the honor to be, sir: your obedient servant,
Beverly Y. Payne U. S. Vice Consul
